dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait. What? It says here, rebuilding Ukraine has now surpassed a trillion dollars? One TRILLION USD?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait. What? It says here, rebuilding Ukraine has now surpassed a trillion dollars? One T R I L L I O N U S D?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shortly after Russias invasion, my co-authors and I estimated that it would cost roughly 200-500 billion ($220-550 billion) to rebuild the country and called for Europe to spearhead the recovery effort. After more than 500 days of death and destruction, the projected costs have probably at least doubled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, it's a huge number, I know, but like, when you consider, you know, the destruction... it's been over 500 days, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, it's a huge number, I know, but like, when you consider, you know, the destruction... it's been over five hundred days, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After more than 500 days of death and destruction, the projected costs have probably at least doubled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A trillion dollars! And they want Europe to pay for it? Um, why Europe? Like, why aren't we still saying the US should be leading this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A trillion dollars! And they want Europe to pay for it? Um, why Europe? Like, why aren't we still saying the U S should be leading this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article, uh, it makes a pretty compelling case. Europe's interests, they're just way more aligned with Ukraine's, economically, geographically, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article, uh, it makes a pretty compelling case. Europe's interests, they're just way more aligned with Ukraine's, economically, geographically, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First, Europes interests are more closely aligned with Ukraines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Aligned. Right. So, like, because some tourists went to Eastern Europe after '89, suddenly it's their problem? Sounds a bit... thin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aligned. Right. So, like, because some tourists went to Eastern Europe after 'eighty nine, suddenly it's their problem? Sounds a bit... thin.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's more than that! The US, its enthusiasm for long-term financial support, it's, um, likely to fade after 2024. Populism, domestic issues, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's more than that! The U S, its enthusiasm for long-term financial support, it's, um, likely to fade after twenty twenty four. Populism, domestic issues, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Second, Europeans must realize that even if US military support for Europe and Ukraine remains intact following the 2024 presidential election a big if, given the current state of US politics Americas enthusiasm for long-term financial support will likely fade, regardless of the outcome. Both Democrats and Republicans are increasingly embracing populist stances, and todays populists focus mostly on domestic issues, with little concern for the rest of the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So we're relying on European goodwill because America might get distracted by, like, TikTok bans or something? Great plan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So we're relying on European goodwill because America might get distracted by, like, TikTok bans or something? Great plan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the EU already granted Ukraine candidate status! They've acknowledged Ukraine is part of Europe. It's, like, a commitment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the E U already granted Ukraine candidate status! They've acknowledged Ukraine is part of Europe. It's, like, a commitment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third, the European Union has already granted Ukraine candidate status, thereby acknowledging that the country is an integral part of Europe and should be part of the bloc.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A candidate status. Which means, what, more paperwork? More committees? Sounds thrilling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A candidate status. Which means, what, more paperwork? More committees? Sounds thrilling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It means they need to step up! Plus, Europe's been free-riding on America's military spending for decades, right? The US spends, like, twice as much as EU members on defense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It means they need to step up! Plus, Europe's been free-riding on America's military spending for decades, right? The U S spends, like, twice as much as E U members on defense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, European countries have been free riding on Americas military expenditure for decades. The US currently spends twice as much as EU member states on national defense as a share of GDP.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, yeah, we know America has a massive military budget. What's that got to do with rebuilding Ukraine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, yeah, we know America has a massive military budget. What's that got to do with rebuilding Ukraine?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Everything! If Europe raised its defense spending to US levels, they'd have an extra, uh, at least $300 billion annually. That's more than enough to pay for Ukraine's reconstruction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Everything! If Europe raised its defense spending to U S levels, they'd have an extra, uh, at least three hundred dollars billion annually. That's more than enough to pay for Ukraine's reconstruction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Conversely, if Europe raised spending to US levels, it would be spending at least $300 billion per year more, easily enough to pay for reconstructing Ukraine and much more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they should spend more on tanks and rebuilding. Sounds like a budget nightmare, not a solution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they should spend more on tanks and rebuilding. Sounds like a budget nightmare, not a solution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's about their historic responsibility, though. This article is, like, really pressing that point. It's not just about money, it's about, um, leadership.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's about their historic responsibility, though. This article is, like, really pressing that point. It's not just about money, it's about, um, leadership.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But European countries must come to terms with their historic responsibility to lead this effort, even if it means higher debt and slower growth for their own economies in the future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Historic responsibility. For a trillion dollars. Good luck with that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Historic responsibility. For a trillion dollars. Good luck with that.
